definition: to add oil to the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning

sentences.english: Im afraid the move will only add fuel to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我怕这么做只会火上加油。

sentences.english: Her tactless remarks just added fuel to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她那些不得体的话简直是火上加油。

sentences.english: And Ted added fuel to the flame by laughing at him.
sentences.chinese: 特德的取笑如火上加油，使他愈加恼怒。

sentences.english: Bob was angry with Ted and Ted added fuel to the flame by laughing at him.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃正生特得的气，而特得还火上加油取笑他。

sentences.english: To spank a crying child just adds fuel to the flame.
sentences.chinese: 欧打一个在哭的小孩，只会火上加油罢了。

sentences.english: His indifference was a fuel to her hatred.
sentences.chinese: 他无动于衷使她心中的怨恨火上加油。

sentences.english: Hikes in fuel prices have led to a further spike in inflation.
sentences.chinese: 而燃料价格的攀升，对通货膨胀更是火上加油。

sentences.english: IV. The scandalous conduct of so-called Christians provided fuels for our persecutors.
sentences.chinese: 许多所谓的基督徒的恶行为这迫害火上加油。

definition: to pour oil on the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
see 惱羞成怒|恼羞成怒[nao3 xiu1 cheng2 nu4]
to upbraid
to add interest (to a story)/to sex up
to bring trouble on oneself
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to get mad/to be very angry
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
to suppress/to restrain
to be more of a hindrance than a help
to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
to provoke
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
